summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 between federal prosecutors from the Southern District of New York and officials from the Palm Beach County Clerk & Comptroller's office. The prosecutors are requesting guidance on obtaining grand jury materials from the 2006 Florida state investigation into Jeffrey Epstein for their ongoing federal investigation and prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell. The chain concludes with the attachment of a signed unsealing order.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The primary correspondent from the Southern District of New York, leading the request for grand jury materials related to Jeffrey Epstein for the ongoing federal investigation and prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: K. Burstein
persons.role: Chief Communications Officer, Clerk & Comptroller's Office
persons.context: A Palm Beach County official who initially responds to the federal prosecutor's request, stating they are not the correct contact and connecting them with the Chief Operating Officer for Courts and Legal Records/Acting General Counsel.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the grand jury materials being sought by federal prosecutors. The materials are from his 2006 state prosecution in Palm Beach County.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the ongoing federal prosecution being handled by the requesting attorneys. The grand jury materials are sought as evidence relevant to her case.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: A colleague of the primary requesting attorney, copied on the initial request for grand jury materials.

connections.description: Colleagues and federal prosecutors working together on the Epstein/Maxwell investigation, as both are copied on the request.
The prosecutor is seeking evidence from Epstein's prior state case for the ongoing federal investigation.
The attorney identifies themselves as one of the prosecutors handling the federal prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell.
Implied by the document, as evidence from Epstein's case is being sought for Maxwell's prosecution.
Engaged in official email correspondence regarding a public records request for grand jury materials.

events.title: State Grand Jury Investigation of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: A grand jury in Palm Beach County, Florida, heard evidence and witness testimony related to the prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Federal Request for State Grand Jury Materials
events.description: Federal prosecutors from the SDNY formally request guidance on obtaining transcripts and records from the 2006 Florida grand jury for their ongoing Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

events.title: Issuance of Federal Unsealing Order
events.description: A federal judge signs an order to unseal the requested grand jury materials, as referenced in the attached file 'Signed_Epsteinimsealing_order October_16_2020.pdf'.

events.title: Transmission of Signed Unsealing Order
events.description: The federal prosecutor emails the signed unsealing order to the Palm Beach County officials.

locations: Southern District of New York, New York, NY 10007
15th Judicial Circuit, Palm Beach County, Florida
Palm Beach County Clerk & Comptroller, 301 N. Olive Ave., 9th Floor, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: In October 2020, federal prosecutors were actively seeking evidence from Jeffrey Epstein's 2006 Florida state grand jury proceedings for their ongoing investigation and the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell.
The prosecutors obtained a signed federal unsealing order to facilitate the release of the state grand jury materials.
The document highlights procedural coordination between federal (SDNY) and state (Florida) jurisdictions in a high-profile case.
The email chain reveals the involvement of the Palm Beach County Clerk & Comptroller's office in handling requests for sensitive court records related to the Epstein case.
The request underscores the continued relevance of evidence from Epstein's earlier state case to the subsequent federal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
